mdRecord.dcterms:title: Anatomical Theater, general view
Old Medical Building
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas (American statesman, architect, and draftsman, 1743-1826) [architect]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Surveyors assessing former site of Anatomical Theater, Hotel A in background

Jefferson designed this building at the request of Dr. Robley Dunglison, the University's first medical professor, and Jefferson's personal physician. Built for the teaching of anatomy; burned and restored 1886; converted to a dispensary. One of the last Jefferson-designed buildings at the University to be started and the only one to be demolished; removed after construction of Alderman Library, 1938-39. Archaeological investigation of site conducted Summer 1997. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
